alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:12PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Niobrara, northwestern Goshen, northern Platte and east central Converse Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 212 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Keeline to 7 miles north of Two Moon Campground to 6 miles west of Glendo. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Guernsey, Glendo, Manville, Keeline, Jay Em, Sibley Peak, Guernsey Campground, Rawhide Buttes, Glendo Reservoir, Two Moon Campground, Hartville and Lost Springs. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 99 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range
